name: Fighter
description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

1.name: Fighting Style
1.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options:

from.name: Archery
from.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

from.name: Defense
from.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

from.name: Dueling
from.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

from.name: Great Weapon Fighting
from.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

from.name: Protection
from.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

from.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
from.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

1.name: Second Wind
1.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

2.name: Action Surge
2.description: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

3.name: Martial Archetype
3.description: You choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

from.name: Champion
from.description: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection.

from.name: Battle Master
from.description: Those who emulate the archetypal Battle Master employ martial techniques passed down through generations.

from.name: Eldritch Knight
from.description: The archetypal Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

6.name: Ability Score Improvement
6.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

7.name: Martial Archetype Feature
7.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

8.name: Ability Score Improvement
8.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

9.name: Indomitable
9.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.

10.name: Martial Archetype Feature
10.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

11.name: Extra Attack (2)
11.description: You can attack three times, instead of twice, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

12.name: Ability Score Improvement
12.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

13.name: Indomitable (two uses)
13.description: You can now use Indomitable twice between long rests.

14.name: Ability Score Improvement
14.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

15.name: Martial Archetype Feature
15.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

16.name: Ability Score Improvement
16.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

17.name: Action Surge (two uses)
17.description: You can use Action Surge twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

17.name: Indomitable (three uses)
17.description: You can now use Indomitable three times between long rests.

18.name: Martial Archetype Feature
18.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

19.name: Ability Score Improvement
19.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

20.name: Extra Attack (3)
20.description: You can attack four times, instead of three, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
